column4: Here is my setup: I have 4x 1.5TB hard drives and 3x 1TB hard drives. The plan is to use one of the 1.5TB drives as the OS drive and then configure the remaining 3 1.5TB drives in software RAID5 and the 3 1TB drives in software RAID5.  So 2 software RAID5 arrays and a single OS drive is the ultimate goal. Does anyone have any alternative suggestions or recommendations while going through this process?
there used to be one that said hello to whoever you were sending it to
It all depends on what you want to do with the box.

fileserver that might be wired in to do media playback as well as serve files to 2 or 3 other media centers in the house.  nothing extremely demanding thus the reason I don't have a dedicated RAID controller or server grade hardware
I'd probably use one of the 1TB drives as the OS and the rest in one big raid10 array
RAID10 - not familiar with that.  Will it allow me to use all of the drive space (RAID5 for all of them would cut off .5TB on the 1.5 drives because N is the smallest drive)

you'd set up three raid1 arrays (something like: md0=two 1.5TB drives, md1=two 1.5TB drives, md2=2 1TB drives) and then RAID0 over that (something like md3=raid0 of md0,md1,and md2) You'd have a total of 4TB, I think.
but it'd be one big array without the "risk" or "disadvantages" of RAID5 (google it, if you want).

I am looking for a solution that gives me maximum space + at least basic redundancy with the hardware I have.  I get 5TB with the setup that I proposed.  do you think any of the disadvantages of RAID5 will cause any bottlenecks in a media center computer?  it will be downloading stuff periodically and have DVD disks copied to it's drives but most of its use will be reading the data.

If your priority is space, then your solution is probably the one (if it's not a problem to have the two different raid disks).  IIRC, the problems with RAID5 is data integrity especially with a failed member of the RAID.
If the data is not "critical" and you are checking on the raid health regularly, it shouldn't be a problem.
so what method should I use to build the RAID5?
you could end up with 5.5TB if you use 1TB for OS, 4x1.5TB RAID5, and 2x1TB RAID1
nice.  Now which filesystem would you recommend for running on the RAID disks?
